fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • The first Englishman to scale Everest, Doug Scott, was born on 29 May 1941, exactly 12 years before Tenzing and Hillary reached the mountain’s summit, not 13 as we said (Doug Scott obituary, 8 December, page 10, Journal). • An interview with Romy Madley Croft described her as the xx’s singer and bassist; that should have said singer and guitarist (Beyond black: Romy’s joyful love letter to queer clubbing, 27 November, page 6, G2). • Other recently amended articles include: 10 adventurers on their trip of a lifetime The golden hour: 15 ways to change your life in a work-from-home lunch break ‘Mini Brexit’: Margaret Thatcher’s statue divides her hometown Qatar get guest spot in European World Cup qualifying group for friendlies Ending UK’s climate emissions ‘affordable’, say official advisers New Zealand man who killed surfer Sean McKinnon jailed for at least 15 years UK’s first all-electric car charging forecourt opens in Essex ‘It’s electrifying’: chess world hails Queen’s Gambit-fuelled boom UK should ban use of spit hoods and Tasers on children, says Unicef Maria Fyfe obituary Checks on goods crossing Irish Sea to start from 1 January
